description: Inherited from Middle English mereswyn (“porpoise, dolphin”), from Old English mereswīn (“porpoise, dolphin”), from Proto-West Germanic *mariswīn, from Proto-Germanic *mariswīną (“dolphin, porpoise, cetacean”); synchronically analyzable as mere +‎ swine or mer- +‎ swine.

entries.meaning: (rare, poetic, archaic) A porpoise or dolphin.
